dmca.title: [Fwd: [ABUSE] Infringing Website based on your server]
dmca.body:
-----Original Message-----
From: The Planet Policy Enforcement [mailto:abuse@theplanet.com] 
Sent: Tuesday, November 22, 2005 3:36 PM
To: copyright@theplanet.com; imiwm@indianmi.org
Subject: [Fwd: [ABUSE] Infringing Website based on your server]

Your email is being forwarded on to our Copyright counsel for review, at the
address of copyright@theplanet.com.

-------- Original Message --------
Subject: [ABUSE] Infringing Website based on your server
Date: Tue, 22 Nov 2005 15:02:51 +0530
From: imiwm <imiwm@indianmi.org>
To: <abuse@theplanet.com>,        <admins@theplanet.com>
CC: infoimi <infoimi@indianmi.org>

To,


To,

No. 1 The sites (allindiansite.com) that facilitate exchange of copyrighted
music through your server.



                  ThePlanet.com Internet Services, Inc.
                  1333 North Stemmons Freeway
                  Suite 110
                  Dallas
                  TX
                  75207
                  United States






                  No. 2 Internet Service providers in India. (List Attached)





                       The sites that facilitate exchange of copyrighted
music through their server.



1.         The Indian Music Industry (IMI) is a non-commercial,
non-profit making organization committed to promote Indian music in India
and across the world. We are affiliated to the international Federation of
Phonographic Industry (IFPI) which is an international organization based in
75 countries and having internationally 1450 members. In India, the Indian
Music Industry has some of the best music companies as its member's viz.;
Universal, Saregama, Tips, Venus, Crescendo, Sony BMG, Virgin, Times Music,
Aditya Music and many others.
 In all. The IMI has more than 80 music companies as its members
representing 75% of all output of legitimate recordings.  The Music Industry
size has shrunk by more than Rs. 500 Crores in 2005; Internet piracy is also
one form of piracy that is impacting the music industry.
 We have observed there are a number of pirated music sites based in servers
abroad that are promoting illegal downloads and streaming of Indian music
(list enclosed).  The Copyright for these musical works is being held by
Indian companies who are our members and no approval / permission for the
same has been taken from either the music industry bodies (PPL / IPRS) or
Individual music companies. Repeated efforts to contact these sites based on
servers in the US and other international countries has not resulted in
desired effects, as there has been no response from their end.

2.         It has come to our notice that the first of you referred in
this notice have established servers in different parts of the world such as
USA, Canada, Germany, Sweden and England. You have stored in your server
copyrighted music of many of our members. You allow access to general public
and facilitate them to download our members'
copyrighted music. Because of the facility that you offer, the sales of our
members' Music has substantially reduced causing our members great economic
loss and substantial reduction of their trade revenues.

3.         You may know that all over the world copyright in music is
protected and infringement of copyright is a civil and criminal wrong.
You should further not both primary and secondary infringement is actionable
as well as punishable. Your server that facilitates general public to
download music that is protected by copyright laws of the member countries
constitutes primary as well as secondary infringement.
We have found that you are also making substantial profits at the expense of
possible future sales of our members. You are also having provision for
advertising through your site and you are charging various sums from the
advertisers as and when the general public visits your site and downloads
illegally the copyrighted music from your site.

4.         Under Section 51 of Indian Copyright Act a copyright will be
deemed to be infringed if any person permits for profit the use of any place
for the communication of  the copyrighted work to the general public. You
must be aware that the various musical work that are available on your site
for downloading by general public is a public communication for profit and
hence will constitute infringement of the copyrights of our members.

5.         The Second of you identified herein are various Internet
Service Providers doing business in the territory of India. Many of the
Indian general public access the various sites identified as the First of
you through the Internet connection provided by the Second of you.
Being in internet business, you must know that Courts all over the world
have held that facilitation of transfer of music files, even without
payment, would constitute infringement of copyrighted work, as it would have
substantial debilitating effect on the legitimate sales of our members
(Napster's case).

6.         The second of you are governed by the provisions of the
Indian Information Technology Act, 2000. Under section 79 of the said Act, a
Network  Service Provider will not be liable only if they prove that the
offence or contravention is committed through their network without their
knowledge or they had exercised due care and intelligence to prevent the
commission of such offence or contravention. By this notice, we put the
Second of you in actual notice of the fact that the First of you are guilty
of intentional copyright violation and the Second of  you is facilitating
the commission of such serious offences.
In view of this notice, any more facility given by  the Second of you to
permit the First of yours illegal downloads will also constitute conspiracy
within the meaning of Section 120-B of Indian Penal Code.

7.         By this notice we finally call upon the First of you to take
off your site the copyrighted music belonging to our members and we also
call upon the Second of you to ensure the prevention of the use of your
service by the First of you and Indian General public to access the sites of
the First of you. For this purpose, the second of you should devise
appropriate software filters that will block out the access of Indian
General Public to the illegal and nefarious sites of the First of you.

8.       Your failure to comply with our demands within 30 days of this
notice reaching you will result in appropriate civil and criminal actions
against all of you holding you responsible of all the costs and consequences
thereof.

            Further to this there is a list of Internet Service providers in
India.

             Regards,

             Mr.Savio D'souza

             Secretary General

             The Indian Music Industry





CC: 1. DOT  (Hard Copy)

       2. President/Secretary of Internet Service Providers Association of
India (Hard Copy)

 3. Secretary of Ministry of Telecom (Hard Copy)

   4. Secretary of HRD (Hard Copy)

   5. Copyright Society of India (Hard Copy)





--
Thanks,

Policy Enforcement
The Planet Internet Services, Inc.
